00031 // Defined in MinionThreeInputReader, cos it can only be in one place.
00032 extern int num_of_constraints;
00033 
00034 template<typename T>
00035 typename T::value_type& index(T& container, int index_pos)
00036 {
00037   if(index_pos < 0 || index_pos >= (int)container.size())
00038     throw parse_exception("Index position " + to_string(index_pos) + 
00039                           " out of range");
00040   return container[index_pos];
00041 }

00043 template<typename FileReader>
00044 void MinionInputReader<FileReader>::parser_info(string s)
00045 {
00046   if(parser_verbose)
00047     cout << s << endl;
00048 }

00050 //%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
00051 // flatten
00052 // type: m (2d matrix), t (3d matrix)
00053 // Flattening is row-wise (2d), plane-wise row-wise (3d).
00054 //%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
00055 template<typename FileReader>
00056 vector<Var> MinionInputReader<FileReader>::flatten(char type, int index) {
00057   unsigned int rowIndex, colIndex, planeIndex ;
00058   vector<Var> flattened ;
00059   // flatten row-wise
00060   if (type == 'm') {
00061     vector< vector<Var> > matrix = Matrices.at(index) ;
00062     for (rowIndex = 0; rowIndex < matrix.size() ; rowIndex++) {
00063       vector<Var> row = matrix.at(rowIndex) ;
00064       for (colIndex = 0; colIndex < row.size(); colIndex++)
00065         flattened.push_back(row.at(colIndex)) ;
00066     }
00067   }
00068   // flatten plane-wise then row-wise
00069   else {
00070     vector< vector <vector <Var> > > tensor = Tensors.at(index) ;
00071     for (planeIndex = 0; planeIndex < tensor.size(); planeIndex++) {
00072       vector< vector <Var> > plane = tensor.at(planeIndex) ;
00073       for (rowIndex = 0; rowIndex < plane.size(); rowIndex++) {
00074         vector<Var> row = plane.at(rowIndex) ;
00075         for (colIndex = 0; colIndex < row.size(); colIndex++)
00076           flattened.push_back(row.at(colIndex)) ;
00077       }
00078     }
00079   }
00080   return flattened ;
00081 }
00082 
00083 //%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
00084 // getColOfMatrix
00085 //%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
00086 template<typename FileReader>
00087 vector<Var> MinionInputReader<FileReader>::getColOfMatrix(vector<vector<Var> >& matrix, int colNo) {
00088   vector<Var> result ;
00089   for (unsigned int rowIndex = 0; rowIndex < matrix.size(); rowIndex++) {
00090     result.push_back(matrix.at(rowIndex).at(colNo)) ;
00091   }
00092   return result ;
00093 }
00094 
00095 //%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
00096 // getRowThroughTensor
00097 //%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
00098 template<typename FileReader>
00099 vector<Var> MinionInputReader<FileReader>::getRowThroughTensor(
00100                                                    vector< vector< vector<Var> > >& tensor, int rowNo, int colNo) {
00101   vector<Var> result ;
00102   for (unsigned int planeIndex = 0; planeIndex < tensor.size() ; planeIndex ++) {
00103     vector< vector<Var> >& plane = tensor.at(planeIndex) ;
00104     vector<Var>& row = plane.at(rowNo) ;
00105     result.push_back(row.at(colNo)) ;
00106   }
00107   return result ;
00108 }

00110 //%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
00111 // read
00112 //%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
00113 template<typename FileReader>
00114 void MinionInputReader<FileReader>::read(FileReader* infile) {  
00115   
00116   while(infile->peek_char() == '#')
00117     parser_info(string("Read comment line:") + infile->getline());
00118 
00119 
00120     readVars(infile) ;
00121     readVarOrder(infile) ;
00122     readValOrder(infile) ;
00123     readMatrices(infile) ;
00124     
00125     // At this point, may or may not have a tuples entry
00126     {
00127       string s = infile->get_string();
00128       if(s == "tuplelists")
00129       {
00130         readTuples(infile);
00131         s = infile->get_string();
00132       }
00133       if(s == "objective")
00134         readObjective(infile);
00135       else
00136       {
00137         throw parse_exception("I don't understand: " + s + ". Did you mean "
00138                                   " tuplelists or objective?");
00139       }
00140     }
00141     readPrint(infile);
00142     
00143     while(readConstraint(infile, false)) ;
00144 
00145 }

00149 //%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
00150 // readConstraint
00151 // Recognise constraint by its name, read past name and leading '('
00152 // Return false if eof or unknown ct. Else true.
00153 //%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
00154 template<typename FileReader>
00155 BOOL MinionInputReader<FileReader>::readConstraint(FileReader* infile, BOOL reified) {
00156   string id = infile->getline('(');
00157   
00158   int constraint_num = -1;
00159   for(int i = 0; i < num_of_constraints; ++i)
00160   {
00161     if(constraint_list[i].name == id)
00162     {
00163       constraint_num = i;
00164       break;
00165     }
00166   }
00167   
00168   if(constraint_num == -1) 
00169   {
00170     if (infile->eof()) 
00171     {
00172       parser_info("Done.") ;
00173       return false;
00174     }
00175     else
00176     { throw parse_exception(string("Unknown Constraint:") + id); }
00177   }
00178   ConstraintDef* constraint = constraint_list + constraint_num;
00179  
00180   switch(constraint->type)
00181   {
00182 #ifdef CT_WATCHED_TABLE_ABC
00183     case CT_WATCHED_TABLE:
00184       readConstraintTable(infile, get_constraint(constraint->type));
00185       break;
00186 #endif
00187 #ifdef CT_WATCHED_NEGATIVE_TABLE_ABC
00188     case CT_WATCHED_NEGATIVE_TABLE:
00189       readConstraintTable(infile, get_constraint(constraint->type));
00190       break;
00191 #endif
00192 
00193     default:
00194       readGeneralConstraint(infile, constraint);
00195   }
00196   
00197   instance.bounds_check_last_constraint();
00198   return true ;
00199 }
00200 
00201 
00202 template<typename FileReader>
00203 void MinionInputReader<FileReader>::readGeneralConstraint(FileReader* infile, ConstraintDef* def)
00204 {
00205   // This slightly strange code is to save copying the ConstraintBlob as much as possible.
00206   instance.add_constraint(ConstraintBlob(def));
00207   ConstraintBlob& con = instance.constraints.back();
00208   vector<vector<Var> >& varsblob = instance.constraints.back().vars;
00209   vector<vector<int> >& constblob = instance.constraints.back().constants;
00210   
00211   for(int i = 0; i < def->number_of_params; ++i)
00212   {
00213     switch(def->read_types[i])
00214     {
00215       case read_list:
00216         varsblob.push_back(readVectorExpression(infile));
00217         break;
00218       case read_var:
00219         varsblob.push_back(make_vec(readIdentifier(infile)));
00220         break;
00221         case read_bool_var:
00222       varsblob.push_back(make_vec(readIdentifier(infile)));
00223       if(varsblob.back().back().type() != VAR_BOOL)
00224         throw parse_exception("Expected Boolean variable!");
00225     break;
00226     
00227       case read_2_vars:
00228       {
00229         vector<Var> vars(2);
00230         vars[0] = readIdentifier(infile);
00231         infile->check_sym(',');
00232         vars[1] = readIdentifier(infile);
00233             varsblob.push_back(MOVE(vars));
00234       }
00235         break;
00236         case read_constraint:
00237         {
00238           // This slightly weird way of getting a constraint is to avoid having to make
00239           // significant changes to the old parser.
00240       readConstraint(infile, false);
00241       ConstraintBlob new_con = instance.constraints.back();
00242       instance.constraints.pop_back();
00243       con.internal_constraints.push_back(new_con);
00244     }
00245     break;
00246     case read_constraint_list:
00247     throw parse_exception("Watched or is not supported by this parser. Use 'MINION 3'");
00248       case read_constant:
00249         constblob.push_back(make_vec(infile->read_num()));
00250         break;
00251       case read_constant_list:
00252       {
00253         vector<Var> vectorOfConst(readVectorExpression(infile)) ;
00254     vector<int> vals;
00255         for(unsigned int loop = 0; loop < vectorOfConst.size(); ++loop)
00256         {
00257           if(vectorOfConst[loop].type() != VAR_CONSTANT)
00258               throw parse_exception("Vector must only contain constants.");
00259             else
00260         vals.push_back(vectorOfConst[loop].pos());
00261         }
00262         constblob.push_back(vals);
00263       }
00264         break;  
00265       default:
00266         D_FATAL_ERROR("Internal Error!");
00267     }
00268     if(i != def->number_of_params - 1)
00269       infile->check_sym(',');
00270   }
00271   infile->check_sym(')');
00272 }
00273 
00274 //%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
00275 // readConstraintElement
00276 // element(vectorofvars, indexvar, var)
00277 //%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
00278 template<typename FileReader>
00279 void MinionInputReader<FileReader>::readConstraintElement(FileReader* infile, ConstraintDef* ctype) {
00280   parser_info("reading an element ct. " ) ;
00281   vector<vector<Var> > vars;
00282   // vectorofvars
00283   vars.push_back(readVectorExpression(infile));
00284   infile->check_sym(',');
00285   // indexvar
00286   vars.push_back(make_vec(readIdentifier(infile)));
00287   infile->check_sym(',');
00288   // The final var is shoved on the end of the vector of vars as it should
00289   // be of a similar type.
00290   // final var
00291   vars[0].push_back(readIdentifier(infile));
00292   infile->check_sym(')');
00293   instance.add_constraint(ConstraintBlob(ctype, vars));
00294 }
00295 
00296 //%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
00297 // readConstraintTable
00298 // table(<vectorOfVars>, {<tuple> [, <tuple>]})
00299 // Tuples represented as a vector of int arrays.
00300 //%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
00301 template<typename FileReader>
00302 void MinionInputReader<FileReader>::readConstraintTable(FileReader* infile, ConstraintDef* def) 
00303 {
00304   parser_info( "reading a table ct (unreifiable)" ) ;
00305   
00306   char delim = ' ';
00307   int count, elem ;
00308   vector<Var> vectorOfVars(readVectorExpression(infile)) ;
00309   int tupleSize = vectorOfVars.size() ;
00310   
00311   infile->check_sym(',');
00312   
00313   char next_char = infile->peek_char();
00314   if(next_char != 't' && next_char != '{')
00315     throw parse_exception("Expected either 't' or a tuple list");
00316   
00317   TupleList* tuplelist;
00318   
00319   if(next_char == 't')
00320   {
00321     infile->check_sym('t');
00322     int tuple_num = infile->read_num();
00323     if(tuple_num >= instance.tupleListContainer->size())
00324     {
00325       throw parse_exception("There are only " + to_string(instance.tupleListContainer->size()) +
00326                                 " tuplelists, requested " + to_string(tuple_num) + ".");
00327     }
00328     tuplelist = instance.tupleListContainer->getTupleList(tuple_num);
00329   }
00330   else
00331   {
00332     vector<vector<int> > tuples ;
00333     infile->check_sym('{');
00334     while (delim != '}') 
00335     {
00336       infile->check_sym('<');
00337       vector<int> tuple(tupleSize);
00338       elem = infile->read_num() ;
00339       tuple[0] = elem ;
00340       for (count = 1; count < tupleSize; count++) 
00341       {
00342         infile->check_sym(',');
00343         elem = infile->read_num() ;
00344         tuple[count] = elem ;
00345       }
00346       infile->check_sym('>');
00347       tuples.push_back(tuple) ;
00348       delim = infile->get_char();                          // ',' or '}'
00349       if(delim != ',' && delim!= '}')
00350         throw parse_exception("Expected ',' or '}'");
00351     }
00352     tuplelist = instance.tupleListContainer->getNewTupleList(tuples);
00353   instance.addUnnamedTableSymbol(tuplelist);
00354   }
00355     
00356     infile->check_sym(')');
00357     ConstraintBlob tableCon(def, vectorOfVars);
00358     tableCon.tuples = tuplelist;
00359     instance.add_constraint(tableCon);
00360 }
00361 
00362 //%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
00363 // readIdentifier
00364 // Expects "<idChar><index>", where <idChar> is 'x', 'v', 'm', 't'.
00365 // Assumes caller knows what idChar should be.
00366 // Returns an object of type Var.
00367 // NB peek() does not ignore whitespace, >> does. Hence use of putBack()
00368 //%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
00369 template<typename FileReader>
00370 Var MinionInputReader<FileReader>::readIdentifier(FileReader* infile) {
00371   char idChar = infile->peek_char();
00372   if ((('0' <= idChar) && ('9' >= idChar)) || idChar == '-') {
00373     int i = infile->read_num();
00374     return Var(VAR_CONSTANT, i);
00375   }
00376   int index = -1 ;
00377   
00378   if(idChar != 'x' && idChar != 'n')
00379   {
00380     string s("Found 'X', expected 'x' or 'n' at start of a variable");
00381     s[7] = idChar;
00382     throw parse_exception(s);
00383   }
00384   
00385   if(idChar == 'x')
00386   {
00387     // Eat the 'x'.
00388     infile->check_sym('x');
00389     index = infile->read_num();
00390     return instance.vars.get_var(idChar, index);
00391   }
00392   
00393   // Must have found an 'n'.
00394   infile->check_sym('n');
00395   infile->check_sym('x');
00396   index = infile->read_num();
00397   Var var = instance.vars.get_var(idChar, index);
00398   if(var.type() != VAR_BOOL)
00399     throw parse_exception("Can only 'not' a Boolean variable!");
00400   var.setType(VAR_NOTBOOL);
00401   return var;
00402 }
00403 
00404 //%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
00405 // readLiteralMatrix
00406 //%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
00407 template<typename FileReader>
00408 vector< vector<Var> > MinionInputReader<FileReader>::readLiteralMatrix(FileReader* infile) {
00409 
00410   infile->check_sym('[');
00411   
00412   // Delim here might end up being "x" or something similar. The reason
00413   // that we peek it is in case whis is an empty vector.
00414   char delim = infile->peek_char();
00415   vector< vector<Var> > newMatrix ;
00416 
00417   if(delim == ']')
00418   {
00419     // Eat the ']'
00420     infile->get_char();
00421     parser_info("Read empty matrix");
00422   }
00423   else
00424   {
00425     while(delim != ']') {
00426       newMatrix.push_back(readLiteralVector(infile)) ;
00427       delim = infile->get_char();            // , or ]
00428     }
00429   }
00430   return newMatrix ;
00431 }
00432 
00433 //%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
00434 // readLiteralVector
00435 // of vars or consts. Checks 1st elem of vect (empty vects not expected)
00436 //  to see which.
00437 //%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
00438 template<typename FileReader>
00439 vector<Var> MinionInputReader<FileReader>::readLiteralVector(FileReader* infile) {
00440   vector<Var> newVector ;
00441   infile->check_sym('[');
00442  
00443   // Delim here might end up being "x" or something similar. The reason
00444   // that we peek it is in case whis is an empty vector.
00445   
00446   char delim = infile->peek_char();
00447         
00448   if(delim == ']')
00449   {
00450     // Eat the ']'
00451     infile->get_char();
00452     parser_info("Read empty vector.");
00453   }
00454   else
00455   {
00456     while (delim != ']') {
00457       newVector.push_back(readIdentifier(infile)) ;
00458       delim = infile->get_char();
00459          if(delim != ',' && delim != ']')
00460          {
00461            // replace X with the character we got.
00462            string s = "Expected ',' or ']'. Got 'X'.";
00463            s[s.size() - 3] = delim;
00464            throw parse_exception(s);
00465          }
00466       }
00467   }
00468   // Squeeze vector to smallest size.
00469   return vector<Var>(newVector.begin(), newVector.end());
00470   
00471 }
00472 
00473 //%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
00474 // readMatrices
00475 //%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
00476 template<typename FileReader>
00477 void MinionInputReader<FileReader>::readMatrices(FileReader* infile) {
00478   char delim ;
00479   int count1 ;
00480   // Read Vectors%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
00481   int noOfMatrixType = infile->read_num();
00482   if(parser_verbose)
00483     cout << "Number of 1d vectors: " << noOfMatrixType << endl ;
00484   for (count1 = 0; count1 < noOfMatrixType; count1++)
00485     Vectors.push_back(readLiteralVector(infile)) ;
00486   // Read 2dMatrices%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
00487   noOfMatrixType = infile->read_num();
00488   if(parser_verbose)
00489     cout << "Number of 2d matrices: " << noOfMatrixType << endl ;
00490   for (count1 = 0; count1 < noOfMatrixType; count1++)
00491     Matrices.push_back(readLiteralMatrix(infile)) ;
00492   // Read 3dMatrices%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
00493   noOfMatrixType = infile->read_num();
00494   if(parser_verbose)
00495     cout << "Number of 3d tensors: " << noOfMatrixType << endl ;
00496   for (count1 = 0; count1 < noOfMatrixType; count1++) {
00497     vector< vector< vector <Var> > > newTensor ;
00498     delim = infile->get_char();                                           // [
00499     while (delim != ']') {
00500       newTensor.push_back(readLiteralMatrix(infile)) ;
00501       delim = infile->get_char();                                    // , or ]
00502     }
00503     Tensors.push_back(newTensor) ;
00504   }
00505 }
00506 
00507 //%%%%
00508 // readTuples
00509 // 'tuplelists' <val>  ( <num_tuples> <tuple_length> <vals> ...
00510 template<typename FileReader>
00511 void MinionInputReader<FileReader>::readTuples(FileReader* infile) {
00512   int tuple_count = infile->read_num();
00513   for(int counter = 0; counter < tuple_count; counter++)
00514   {
00515     int num_of_tuples = infile->read_num();
00516     int tuple_length = infile->read_num();
00517     TupleList* tuplelist = instance.tupleListContainer->getNewTupleList(num_of_tuples, tuple_length);
00518     instance.addUnnamedTableSymbol(tuplelist);
00519     int* tuple_ptr = tuplelist->getPointer();
00520     for(int i = 0; i < num_of_tuples; ++i)
00521       for(int j = 0; j < tuple_length; ++j)
00522       {
00523         tuple_ptr[i * tuple_length + j] = infile->read_num();
00524       }
00525     tuplelist->finalise_tuples();
00526   }
00527 }
00528 
00529 //%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
00530 // readObjective
00531 // 'objective' 'none' | 'minimising' <var> | 'maximising' <var>
00532 //%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
00533 template<typename FileReader>
00534 void MinionInputReader<FileReader>::readObjective(FileReader* infile) {
00535   // Note that we will have read "objective" before entering this function.
00536   string s = infile->get_string();
00537   if(s == "none")
00538   {
00539     parser_info( "objective none" );
00540     return;
00541   }
00542   
00543   if(s != "minimising" && s != "maximising")
00544   {
00545     throw parse_exception(string("Expected 'none', 'maximising'") +
00546                               string("or 'minimising'. Got '") + s + "'");
00547   }
00548   
00549   BOOL minimising = (s == "minimising");
00550   Var var = readIdentifier(infile) ;
00551   if(parser_verbose)
00552     cout << ((minimising) ? "minimising" : "maximising") << var << endl ;
00553   instance.set_optimise(minimising, var);
00554 }
00555 
00556 template<typename FileReader>
00557 void MinionInputReader<FileReader>::readPrint(FileReader* infile) {
00558   string s = infile->get_string();
00559   if(s != "print")
00560     throw parse_exception(string("Expected 'print', recieved '")+s+"'");
00561   
00562   char letter = infile->get_char();
00563   if(letter == 'n')
00564   {
00565     s = infile->get_string();
00566     if(s != "one")
00567       throw parse_exception(string("I don't understand '")+s+"'");
00568     parser_info( "print none" );
00569     return;
00570   }
00571   else if(letter == 'a')
00572   {
00573     s = infile->get_string();
00574     if(s != "ll")
00575       throw parse_exception(string("I don't understand '" + s + "'"));
00576                               
00577     instance.print_matrix = make_vec(instance.vars.get_all_vars());
00578     return;
00579   }
00580   else if(letter == 'm')
00581   {
00582     int matrix_num = infile->read_num();
00583     instance.print_matrix = index(Matrices, matrix_num);
00584     if(parser_verbose)
00585       cout << "print m" << matrix_num << endl;
00586     return;
00587   }
00588   else if(letter == 'v')
00589   {
00590     int vec_num = infile->read_num();
00591     instance.print_matrix = make_vec(index(Vectors, vec_num));
00592     if(parser_verbose)
00593       cout << "print v" << vec_num << endl;
00594     return;
00595   }
00596 
00597   throw parse_exception(string("I don't understand this print statement"));
00598 }
00599 
00600 //%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
00601 // readValOrder
00602 // '[' <valOrderIdentifier> [, <valOrderIdentifier>]* ']'
00603 // <valOrderIdentifier> := 'a' | 'd' --- for ascending/descending
00604 //%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
00605 template<typename FileReader>
00606 void MinionInputReader<FileReader>::readValOrder(FileReader* infile) {
00607   parser_info( "Reading val order" ) ;
00608   
00609   infile->check_sym('[');
00610   
00611   // Delim here might end up being "x" or something similar. The reason
00612   // that we peek it is in case whis is an empty vector.
00613   
00614   char delim = infile->peek_char();
00615   
00616   vector<char> valOrder ;
00617      
00618   if(delim == ']')
00619   {
00620     // Eat the ']'
00621     infile->get_char();
00622     parser_info("No val order");
00623   }
00624   else
00625   {
00626     while (delim != ']') {
00627       char valOrderIdentifier = infile->get_char();
00628       if(valOrderIdentifier != 'a' && valOrderIdentifier != 'd')
00629         throw parse_exception("Expected 'a' or 'd'");
00630       valOrder.push_back(valOrderIdentifier == 'a');
00631       delim = infile->get_char();                                 // , or ]
00632     }
00633 
00634     ostringstream s;
00635     s << "Read val order. Length: " << valOrder.size();
00636     parser_info(s.str());
00637   }
00638   
00639   if(valOrder.empty())
00640   {
00641     parser_info("No value order given, generating automatically");
00642     valOrder = vector<char>(instance.search_order.back().var_order.size(), true);
00643   }
00644   instance.search_order.back().val_order = valOrder;
00645 }
00646 
00647 //%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
00648 // readVarOrder
00649 // '[' <var> [, <var>]* ']'
00650 //%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
00651 template<typename FileReader>
00652 void MinionInputReader<FileReader>::readVarOrder(FileReader* infile) {
00653   parser_info( "Reading var order" ) ;
00654   vector<Var> varOrder = readLiteralVector(infile);
00655   
00656   ostringstream s;
00657   s << "Read var order. Length: " << varOrder.size();
00658   
00659   if(varOrder.empty())
00660   {
00661     parser_info("No order generated, auto-generating complete order");
00662     int var_count = 0;
00663     var_count += instance.vars.BOOLs;
00664     for(unsigned i = 0; i < instance.vars.bound.size(); ++i)
00665       var_count += instance.vars.bound[i].first;
00666     for(unsigned i = 0; i < instance.vars.sparse_bound.size(); ++i)
00667       var_count += instance.vars.sparse_bound[i].first;
00668     for(unsigned i = 0; i < instance.vars.discrete.size(); ++i)
00669       var_count += instance.vars.discrete[i].first;
00670     for(unsigned i = 0; i < instance.vars.sparse_discrete.size(); ++i)
00671       var_count += instance.vars.sparse_discrete[i].first;
00672     
00673     varOrder.reserve(var_count);
00674     for(int i = 0; i < var_count; ++i)
00675       varOrder.push_back(instance.vars.get_var('x',i));
00676   }
00677   
00678   
00679   instance.search_order.push_back(varOrder);
00680   //var_order = varOrder;
00681   parser_info(s.str());
00682 }
00683 
00684 //%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
00685 template<typename FileReader>
00686 void MinionInputReader<FileReader>::readVars(FileReader* infile) {
00687   int lb, ub, count ;
00688   char delim ;
00689   ProbSpec::VarContainer var_obj;
00690   // Read 01Vars%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
00691   int noOfVarType = infile->read_num();
00692   if(parser_verbose)
00693     cout << "Number of 01 Vars: " << noOfVarType << endl ;
00694   var_obj.BOOLs = noOfVarType;
00695   
00696   
00697   // **** Construct this many 01Vars
00698   // Read Bounds Vars%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
00699   noOfVarType = infile->read_num();
00700   if(parser_verbose)
00701     cout << "Number of Bounds Vars: " << noOfVarType << endl ;
00702   while (noOfVarType > 0) {
00703     lb = infile->read_num();
00704     ub = infile->read_num();
00705     if(lb > ub)
00706       throw parse_exception("Lower bound must be less than upper bound!");
00707     count = infile->read_num();
00708     if(parser_verbose)
00709       cout << count << " of " << lb << ", " << ub << endl ;
00710     var_obj.bound.push_back(make_pair(count, Bounds(lb, ub)));
00711     noOfVarType -= count ;
00712   }
00713   
00714   // Read Sparse Bounds Vars%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
00715   noOfVarType = infile->read_num();
00716   if(parser_verbose)
00717     cout << "Number of Sparse Bounds Vars: " << noOfVarType << endl ;
00718   int domainElem ;
00719   while (noOfVarType > 0) {
00720     vector<int> domainElements ;
00721     delim = infile->get_char();                                 // {
00722     while (delim != '}') {
00723       domainElem = infile->read_num();
00724       domainElements.push_back(domainElem) ;
00725       size_t dom_size = domainElements.size();
00726       if(dom_size > 1)
00727       {
00728         if(domainElements[dom_size-1] <= domainElements[dom_size-2])
00729           throw parse_exception("Domains must be ordered!");
00730       }
00731       delim = infile->get_char();                               // , or }
00732     }
00733     count = infile->read_num();
00734     if(parser_verbose)
00735       cout << count << " of these " << endl ;
00736     // **** Construct this many discrete vars.
00737     var_obj.sparse_bound.push_back(make_pair(count, domainElements));
00738     noOfVarType -= count ;
00739   }
00740   
00741   // Read Discrete Bounds Vars%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
00742   noOfVarType = infile->read_num();
00743   if(parser_verbose)
00744     cout << "Number of Discrete Vars: " << noOfVarType << endl ;
00745   while (noOfVarType > 0) {
00746     lb = infile->read_num();
00747     ub = infile->read_num();
00748     count = infile->read_num();
00749     if(lb > ub)
00750       throw parse_exception("Lower bound must be less than upper bound!");
00751     if(parser_verbose)
00752       cout << count << " of " << lb << ", " << ub << endl ;
00753     var_obj.discrete.push_back(make_pair(count, Bounds(lb, ub)));
00754     // **** Construct this many discrete bounds vars.
00755     noOfVarType -= count ;
00756   }
00757   // Read Discrete Vars%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
00758   noOfVarType = infile->read_num();
00759   if(parser_verbose)
00760     cout << "Number of Sparse Discrete Vars: " << noOfVarType << endl ;
00761   while (noOfVarType > 0) {
00762     vector<int> domainElements ;
00763     delim = infile->get_char();                                 // {
00764     while (delim != '}') {
00765       domainElem = infile->read_num();
00766       domainElements.push_back(domainElem) ;
00767       delim = infile->get_char();                             // , or }
00768     }
00769     count = infile->read_num();
00770     if(parser_verbose)
00771       cout << count << " of these " << endl ;
00772     // **** Construct this many discrete vars.
00773     var_obj.sparse_discrete.push_back(make_pair(count, domainElements));
00774     noOfVarType -= count ;
00775   }
00776   
00777   instance.vars = var_obj;
00778 }
00779 
00780 //%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
00781 // readVectorExpression
00782 // literal vector (of vars or consts), vi, mi(flattened), ti(flattened),
00783 // row(mi, r), col(mi, c), col(ti, p, c), rowx(ti, p, r), rowz(ti, r, c)
00784 // NB Expects caller knows whether vars or consts expected for lit vect.
00785 // NB peek does not ignore wspace, >> does. Hence use of putback
00786 //%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%%
00787 template<typename FileReader>
00788 vector<Var> MinionInputReader<FileReader>::readVectorExpression(FileReader* infile) {
00789   char  delim ;
00790   int row, col, plane ;
00791   int input_val;
00792   char idChar = infile->get_char();
00793   switch (idChar) {
00794     case '[':
00795       parser_info( "Reading Literal Vector of vars or consts" ) ;
00796       infile->putback(idChar) ;
00797       return readLiteralVector(infile) ;      
00798     case 'v':                                        // vector identifier
00799       parser_info( "Reading vector identifier" ) ;
00800       //infile->putback(idChar) ;
00801       input_val = infile->read_num();
00802       return Vectors.at(input_val) ;
00803     case 'm':                                       // matrix identifier
00804       parser_info( "Reading matrix identifier (will flatten)" ) ;
00805       //infile->putback(idChar) ;
00806       input_val = infile->read_num();
00807       return flatten('m', input_val) ;
00808     case 't':                                        // matrix identifier
00809       parser_info( "Reading tensor identifier (will flatten)" ) ;
00810       //infile->putback(idChar) ;
00811       input_val = infile->read_num();
00812       return flatten('t', input_val) ;
00813     case 'r':                                       // row of a mx/tensor
00814       infile->check_sym('o');
00815       infile->check_sym('w');
00816       idChar = infile->get_char();            // o w [( x or z]
00817       switch(idChar) {
00818         case '(':                                        // row of a matrix
00819         {parser_info( "Reading row of a matrix" ) ;
00820           infile->check_sym('m');
00821           input_val = infile->read_num();
00822           vector< vector<Var> > matrix = Matrices.at(input_val) ;
00823           delim = infile->get_char();
00824           row = infile->read_num();
00825           delim = infile->get_char();
00826           return matrix.at(row) ;}
00827         case 'x':                             // row of a plane of a tensor
00828         {parser_info( "Reading row of a plane of a tensor" ) ;
00829           infile->check_sym('(');
00830           infile->check_sym('t');
00831           input_val = infile->read_num();
00832           vector< vector< vector<Var> > >& tensor = Tensors.at(input_val) ;
00833           infile->check_sym(',');
00834           input_val = infile->read_num();
00835           vector< vector <Var> >& tensorPlane = tensor.at(input_val) ;
00836           infile->check_sym(',');
00837           input_val = infile->read_num();
00838           infile->check_sym(')');
00839           return tensorPlane.at(input_val);
00840         }
00841         case 'z':                         // Row through planes of a tensor
00842         {parser_info( "Reading row through planes of a tensor" ) ;
00843           infile->check_sym('(');
00844           input_val = infile->read_num();
00845           vector< vector< vector<Var> > >& tensor = Tensors.at(input_val) ;
00846           infile->check_sym(',');
00847           row = infile->read_num();
00848           infile->check_sym(',');
00849           col = infile->read_num();
00850           infile->check_sym(')');
00851           return getRowThroughTensor(tensor, row, col) ;}
00852         default:
00853           throw parse_exception("Malformed Row Expression");
00854           break ;
00855       }
00856         break ;
00857       //col(mi, c), col(ti, p, c)
00858     case 'c':                                        // col of a mx/tensor
00859       infile->check_sym('o');
00860       infile->check_sym('l');
00861       infile->check_sym('(');
00862       if(infile->peek_char() == 'm') {
00863         parser_info( "Reading col of matrix" ) ;
00864         infile->check_sym('m');
00865         input_val = infile->read_num();
00866         vector< vector<Var> >& matrix = Matrices.at(input_val) ;
00867         infile->check_sym(',');
00868         col = infile->read_num();
00869         infile->check_sym(')');
00870         return getColOfMatrix(matrix, col) ;
00871       }
00872         else {
00873           parser_info( "Reading col of tensor" ) ;
00874           infile->check_sym('t');
00875           input_val = infile->read_num();
00876           vector< vector< vector<Var> > >& tensor = Tensors.at(input_val);
00877           infile->check_sym(',');
00878           plane = infile->read_num();
00879           infile->check_sym(',');
00880           col = infile->read_num();
00881           infile->check_sym(')');
00882           return getColOfMatrix(tensor.at(plane), col) ;
00883         }
00884       default:
00885         throw parse_exception("Malformed Vector Expression") ;
00886         break ;
00887   }
00888   FAIL_EXIT("?");
00889 }
